page.title: 20LOWESWATER'S MRS. STUDHOLME
page.content: Mrs. Studholme age 81, now living with her daughter at Red How, was born at Lanthwaite Cottage & lived there until 2 years ago. Her grandfather Vickers lived at Nether Close where her mother was born. It is still owned by the family. Her father & uncle worked for the Marshall estate which comprised the lakes Buttermere, Crummock & Loweswater, Holme & Lanthwaite Wood & many farms & houses in the valley. The lakes were netted in Spring & Summer to supply fish to local hotels. Most household purchases were delivered monthly by pony & trap but for special items her mother walked to Cockermouth. The Scalehill Hotel was called the Bunch of Grapes & the Kirkstyle Inn the Hare and Hound. They were traditional Inn-Farms of the Lake District & renowned for their Hunt suppers on New Years Day & Boxing Day.
